Really ingenious how this director managed to make a movie with this concept (and potential) so bad. The movie immediately gives away that the lead role is in fact a robot. This could've functioned as a huge plot-twist, but no they f**k it up.. Furthermore, the script is awful and boring, no connection to the characters whatsoever. This also includes a lot of suspense moments in the movie with a silence and dramatic music, while in the end nothing happens.Considering that the movie takes place 97 years after the robot take- over/apocalypse, one would assume that the lead role (who just woke up after 97 years) has some questions. But no, he accepts everything he sees. Also, there is no sign of erosion on buildings, even some windows are still intact. At one point in the movie, the lead characters walk into a house. Where after 97 years, there is still not one molecule of dust, come on! The roofs of all buildings are still intact and there is no grass growing all over the place, which you would normally expect if you let nature run its course. Since (as the movie claims) 8 billion people were killed overnight, i find it astonishing that there are no skeletons all over the place. In the movie you only see skeletons once, neatly stacked in a river. Then i am wondering, did the skeletons walk to the river, or what? Well, i could go on and on about this horrible movie but i thinks this gives the general image.Summary of this movie: A disgrace!

reviews.review_title: Destroy All Humans! Destroy All Humans!
reviews.content: Destroy all humans, destroy all humans. Why? Because humans hurt the beautiful Earth. But they've flown to other planets. They no longer are on the Earth. Then we shall hunt them to the very ends of the universe. Why? Destroy all humans, destroy all humans.

Pretty well everything else about this movie was bad.

The acting was poor.
The movie wasn't even enjoyably bad.
It was just mediocre and pointless.Not worth watching.

I consider my girlfriend lucky cos she fell a sleep half way XD and now she rates me 1 star cos I am writing this review instead of paying attention to her.so anyway stay away from this movie

reviews.review_title: Probably one of the worst movies ever made
reviews.content: When I decided to watch this, it had a 7.2 rating. By then I didn't consider that the reason for this score were fake ratings. Why should I? There's John Cusack, and an interesting description. I just went for it. When I started to watch this I couldn't believe it. Most people in this movie did a lousy job, especially the director, screenwriters, actors, special effects team, even make up artists. But the saddest thing about this "movie" was seeing a good actor who clearly doesn't want to be there. You almost can hear his thoughts while he's "acting": "What have I done?" "Why did I agree to this?". Finally, it's a very low move to save money that could be spent on the movie, just to buy fake IMDb ratings. Besides being illegal, maybe the quality would have been a bit better, like two stars instead of one. This is only suitable for one of those marathons with friends of the worst movies ever made, to laugh at it.

reviews.review_title: this is a pretty horrible movie
reviews.content: The acting is poor. the kids do their best but....they fail. script is from the 60's. main girl is a rip off of hunger games. they never even get dirty in all their adventures.i gave up half way through.

So one morning after a hard night of drinking, John Cusacks alarm went off and he totally forgot about making this film that day, but he's dedicated so he rolled over put on the clothes that were lying on the floor next to his futon, smelling like vomit and went to work...and it shows. But back to the actual movie... Its the exact same plot as Terminator Salvation... I'll describe it vaguely. A guy that was alive before the world ended, now wakes up in a dead world. How did the world die? Man created artificial intelligence, and artificial intelligence wiped out man. So this guy meets another person, who is going to the last human stronghold against the A.I. Sound familiar yet? So if you saw Terminator Salvation, you'll able to recognize the story already and go, ummm, that dude is a robot, working for the A.I. to gain access to the human stronghold. And you would be 100% correct, sir. But instead of Kyle Reese, we get a spitting image of Katniss Everdeen. If you want an excellent film to make your own laugh tracks too, I would recommend this one!! Filmbufftim on FB.

reviews.review_title: Another "it could have been good" movie
reviews.content: A billionaire mad scientist (I guess) decides the human race is a bad thing. He attempts to erradicate people and replace them with machines and computers. Not all that original. John Cusack has done some great movies. This isn't one of them. The only thing that saves this film from being a complete steaming pile of crap is the cinematography. The story, script and acting are all pretty awful. I hope the kids are planning on college and real careers.

reviews.review_title: OMG! Looks like it was Made for 10 Cents!

This is by far the worst movie of 2017. Just don't watch it, it's a waste of time!! So many mistakes and dumb actions. Casting is awful. the story is probably written by a child. I just cannot believe that this movie is made in 2017, well if you watch this movie you will remember this review and agree.

Elias Van Dorne (John Cusack) is CEO of VA Industries which is one of the largest robotics companies in the world. It's latest creation is Kronos which are robots who have been created as a tool to prevent all wars. However, Kronos sees humankind as the real threat and as a result of this Kronos wipes out the majority of the human population. A few human survivors are believed to be living in Aurora which is the last human stronghold and Van Dorne uses a robot who can mimic human emotions and a female human freedom fighter in order to discover the whereabouts of Aurora in order to wipe out the rest of civilisation...To me, the film poster for this film seemed to suggest that Singularity would be more of an action-orientated picture, but it doesn't actually play out like this at all and unfortunately in this case that turns out to be a bad thing..In fairness, a science-fiction film doesn't always have to go overboard in the action stakes in order for it to be enjoyable, but if a film chooses to put focus on narrative rather than action then it really needs to have something worthwhile to say which just doesn't happen here. OK so a robot army has destroyed civilisation because it determines that they are the real threat. This is a fairly interesting way to set the story up, but it fails to delve any deeper and as a result of this you're left with a film that offers no real social commentary or critique on anything that happens. This perhaps wouldn't be as much of an issue if anything else remotely of interest was going on anywhere else, but the truth is that it isn't.As I've previously mentioned, I felt like I had been mis sold on this film being about survivors fighting and battling the machines in order to survive. The reality however is that Van Dorne is using them to discover Aurora which actually makes for a much less exciting picture. You know full well that they're going to survive at the end (or else how is Van Dorne going to find out the location of Aurora). This in turn makes the picture fairly uninteresting, predictable and results in a complete lack of tension existing throughout the film.Further problems with the picture relate to its general lack of explanation for certain things within the story; such as how people have managed to survive on Aurora for the past 97 years when the rest of civilisation has been destroyed? What exactly are they living on? A human robot and a human freedom-fighter have real difficulties escaping Kronos to get to Aurora yet 1000's of civilians have managed to escape Kronos to Aurora with no explanation of how they managed to do this?Perhaps the worst thing about this film lies with the ending which isn't actually an ending it's actually just lazily left open to allow an inevitable sequel to come along. In fact, this whole film could merely be seen as a very long dull trailer to set up the second film in the franchise and given how poor this film is I can safely say I won't be checking out the sequel to this film should it ever materialise.

reviews.review_title: Corny as I don't know what
reviews.content: This movie really could have been so much better. The acting to this movie was the worst with the two main characters. When you see this movie you expect to see something different and the only good things about this film was the CGI and the special effects. John Cusack was barely in the movie. This movie was basically about how a woman falls in love with a robot. This movie was trashhh. I wish there was more imagination to this movie with people who know how to act.

A boring story came with bad acting and nonsense dialog together in this movie. I barely could watch it until the end. I really don't understand, how it's possible for such a bad movie gets this high rating. Don't waste your time with "Singularity"! It's a pretty bad movie

This is the worst movie I've seen for a few years. It's a mish-mash of ripped-off ideas from other (read: cash-making) classics - Terminator and Hunger Games are the first to come to mind. How cheesy to have a heroine, 98 years after the doom of civilization enter the scene in a tight body outfit, arrow (ok, a crossbow ;), perfect make-up and a smart-ass remark. Yes, dialogues are terrible, and so is acting). And so is the "voiceover" for the dimmer / lazier of the audience, to explain what is actually happening. Looking at how bad the movie is, and yet, with a 6.4 out of 10 rating, the allegations of rating-bumpings take on some credibility :/p.s. it appears I'm not the only one to have registered on IMDb to protest against false reviews bumping up this awful, awful production!

reviews.review_title: This movie could have EASILY been an 8, but it WASN'T
reviews.content: I only gave it a 4 and I should only give it a 2. It got a 4 because it was that bad and it appears the only people that really showed up to work on it were the Camera and SFX's people. Many of the scenes, Robots and Scenic background shots were awesome. The rest was disappointing, to say the least. It should have only gotten 2 Stars for completely blowing an excellent opportunity to make a great movie and an even better Sequel. This could have easily become a 3 movie series and did high bucks at the box office. Too many issues. The actors didn't even get dirty, perfect hair, new clothes, make-up, NAILS, etc. No attention to detail of the story or plot. Were the only other humans to survive Hair, Make-up, Nails and clothes makers?With some better prep and acting, this movie could have easily been an 8. But they didn't and it isn't.Go ahead and watch it and make up your own mind, but make sure you write a review and vote on it to offset the Purchased IMDb positive reviews and votes for it. If you are wondering how they do it, I was to so I went to a couple of sights and asked them. They obtain, (buy, beg, steal), abandoned user ID's and do votes that way. They sell them by the 25's. If you want 25, 5-star votes, it will cost you around $18 dollars and goes up from there. Same with reviews, but they cost more. You know your movie sucks when you have to buy favorable reviews and up-votes.

reviews.review_title: I'm not surprised this movie is from Switzerland, it's cheesy and full of holes.
reviews.content: Let's start with what this movies does right, the CG is amazing. Next, this movie came out in 2017 but says robotics will have this kind of leap in what 3 years? I don't think so, movie should have been like 2145 or something. Second, movie pretty much rips off way better sci-fi stories from Terminator, Cleopatra 2525 to the Matrix. Let's talk about Van Dorne's plan. Because one man used his robots to murder innocents making him take the blame for unknown reasons. So the answer is killing all people, so the spilling of some innocent blood is so bad the answer is spilling more innocent blood? That makes perfectly no sense, but any excuse for humans to fight robots I guess. Thirdly, if Elias Van Dorne was determined to wipe out mankind because we don't deserve to live, logically speaking he should have stuck his main computer to automatic before blowing his brains out. Instead, he turns himself and his best friends into cyborgs, the problem is humans killing not being made of flesh. So that makes no sense other the filmmakers paid star John Cusack too much money to kill him off early even though that would make sense. Fourth, why Singularity? There is nothing about space, black holes or time travel, title makes no sense, like everything in this movie. Lastly, speaking of John Cusack. What a waste of a good actor. All he does is look either pissed off or bored through the whole movie, I'm guessing he was to lose human emotion now being some kind of cyborg but it doesn't explain him pretty much doing nothing except saying bad stilted dialog to Carmen Argenziano which has nothing to do with the other part of the movie. Switzerland should stick to cheese and clocks, the film industry is trash. I don't know how much this movie cost but since it got back less then five grand I'm guess there won't be a sequel and this spell the end of Swiss film. Because like Swiss cheese, it was cheesy and full of holes.

reviews.review_title: The male lead has a designer hair cut in the apocalyps, why????
reviews.content: How does the main lead have perfectly new store bought clothes and a salon haircut????
I've seen a porn with better acting. Worst movie i saw in last 10 years.

reviews.review_title: Exactly like Terminator......if it was poorly written and acted.
reviews.content: Before I talk about this "movie" I really need to have this one major question that needs to be answered.Can someone please explain why was John Cusack wearing lipstick....yes I said lipstick. I'm guessing he doesn't look menacing enough with his bad hair transplant/weave/extensions/dead rodent hairstyle? I should have known to shut it off then but couldn't find the remote, wish I had looked a little harder in retrospect.This movie felt like a Asylum version of Terminator, complete with crappy CGI, a plot that seems to go nowhere and main characters that you could care less if they lived or died. Basically think of every cliché hero/villain, every cliché situation those hero's and villains can find themselves and this is what you get.I genuinely tried to like this movie, even though I should no better by now to skip Cusack's movies, his One Crazy Summer and Gross Point Blank days have long since passed, along with his hairline and good judgement when it comes to taking roles. Really hoping this truly is a Singularity as I definitely wouldn't watch a sequel.

You know the time when you've been forced to use a Portaloo in the middle of summer, straight after someone who's had a massive dump, you remember, the smell, the heat, the flies and the warm seat, well that's Singularity right there. Well it would if you added in the fact that there was no paper left!

Unbelievable. I saw an 8/10 and so watched the movie in the hope to see some "Transcendence"-sort of making. Cusak in the cast seemed OK ... never felt so betrayed. There is nothing - and I mean literally nothing - that wouldn't be lousy in this movie. The actors, all of them, including but not limited to Cusak look like a bunch of high-school drama group newbies trying to improvise their 1st act.The "special effects" are really very special, someone probably dusted off an Atari ST just to prove it could be used for SFX in 2017. I will most certainly remember the names Robert Kouba (director) and Sebastian Cepeda (story) and avoid any of their future cinematographic creations like the plague. I recommend you do the same.Honestly, I am just missing the words how bad this movie is. As a high school movie project this would get an E - best case. This is my 1st review on IMDb ever and I can recommend this movie to serve as one purpose only: torture.
...AND I HAD TO TURN IT OFF.I wasn't at all sure which movie it was they were copying. It was so hard to watch

reviews.review_title: How can this movie be rated 5.9. Come on

Are they just giving away money to anyone to make movies now? if so can i get on that list plz.
