I can´t believe my cable movie rental actually charged me for this. I feel robbed. This repulsive and utterly stupid "movie" is exactly what supporters of piracy needs; proof that the industry is urinating on the audience.
ANY upvote of this travesty is fake. Guaranteed.
Every single thing about this film is just plain awful - the script, acting, sets, fx, literally everything

A slick but empty YA dystopian film with 'borrowed' themes from far superior Sci-Fi like Blade Runner, The Matrix and even Planet of the Apes. The opening production value and John Cusack's presence lend the film enough credibility to lure you in, then quickly flounders into poor melodrama with even worse writing. It feels like a film that had a story and vision at one time, then found itself over-budget and went into turnaround. Over eager Writer/Director Robert Kouba clearly focused on the opening and conclusion, putting everything into the special effects and even a soundtrack by members of The Crystal Method. Suddenly with no money left, and little more than a student film reel in the can, Kouba roughly stitched together some nonsensical plot points with flat characters and even flatter acting to fill out the 93 minute runtime.The ultimate tragedy is that it clearly sets up for a sequel, so it feels less like a complete film than a bloated trailer to some yet-to-come flick. I dare say that film isn't coming and I hope you already cashed that paycheck, John.

This is my first ever review, and it won't be so much a review as it is warning and advice not to watch this movie. Stupidest and more idiotic movies seen in a very long time. No point in going to details, the people before me already wrote it down... Justin DON'T waste you time on this crap.

reviews.review_title: Low End, Low screenplay, low everything
reviews.content: Take a bit of Matrix, Terminator, 2 young actors, 1 (normally) good actor (just here to pay the bills), shake well and You'll get Singularity.Just several problems: screenplay is weak, ugly SFX effects, and the actors have charisma equals to my dog........(an insult for my dog)Forget about this film, and beware false ratings....

The acting wasn't bad. That's my glass-half-full perspective.
Netflix had this rated 4.5 stars, so I thought I'd give it a try. The story was bad. Not the worst ever to be certain, but it was predictable, and the one big twist at the end made no sense whatsoever.
The direction was the worst part. The most glaring miss: After 100 years of humanity being hunted to extinction, two of the last survivors have perfectly coiffed hair and clean clothes.
I thought about a drinking game where you do a shot every time you see a plot-hole, but it you'd have alcohol poisoning in the first 30 minutes.

reviews.review_title: Spoiler alert - observing paint dry is FAR more entertaining
reviews.content: First time I've ever been able to use this phrase, and believe me, I don't use it lightly..... Watch this movie - and witness the moment John Cusack jumped the shark. What was he thinking??? Is there any return from this complete and utter drivel? Just about every single frame of this movie is filled with inaccuracies, set 97 years after most of human life destroyed, yet they run through perfectly planted fields of grain, use electrical devices that never need a charge, encounter a group of about a dozen people, some brandishing machine guns, have basically a fist fight, stab a couple and the rest seem to just vanish (not a special effect - I think the person who wrote this forgot about the rest of them at this point). The mind boggles as to why anyone thought it was a good idea after reading this script to then go ahead and spend money making the "film". Please - do yourself a favour and buy a little sample pot of paint, nice and cheap, and paint a bit of wall with it - then sit and watch that dry. Maybe eat popcorn for a full on experience - it'll be better than this!

Others have given more details reasons why (some rambling and incoherent, but hey, maybe they're just passionate) but the gist is the same; bad movie.Acting, even Cusack, is poor at best. Cusack's not given a lot to work with but it feels like he's just mailing it in. Argenziano does probably the best job and even his effort is spotty; weak here and fine there.The story itself is the weakest part, naturally. 97 years after a robot apocalypse, this girl well dressed in fresh, clean clothes, is surviving against a massive robot force. They can sit around a campfire with no fear of detection, but playing music instantly summons the machines. Machines without heat detection and that's can't hear a human breathing 10 feet away. Sigh.Even the romantic aspects of the film are just unbelievable. Calia goes completely against everything that has kept her alive, almost overnight.Gah, there's more, but the movie isn't worth the time. It's a B movie at best, full of things that make you want to scream, and you'll wish you'd watched something else when you're done. Do yourself a favor and WATCH SOMETHING ELSE and save yourself the fate we've suffered.

reviews.review_title: Lacklustre performances make for painful viewing
reviews.content: This movie as others have pointed out is hardly original and indeed is for the most part painful to both the eyes and ears. Watching this film is akin to having your face peeled off with a cheese grater, it's not something you would want to do twice.There are a few brief moments where the film is not coma inducing, however the director did not do his job and direct, it seems more likely that the actors were given scant instructions and were unmotivated. Some of the CGI work is not too bad for a B grade film though it would in many places give the infamous Troma-vision a run for it's money.Overall, a young director/writer who produced his first feature length film, it's by no means the worst film in history but it's far from being the best.Only watch this if you want to become depressed at how bad a film can be, or if you like coma inducing junk.

reviews.review_title: Why does Netflix keep giving garbage movies 95+%?
reviews.content: I'm going to be honest. I watched about 30 min of this movie. It's a decent premise with a C- execution. But my real question is why Netflix keep trying to tell me that I'd like garbage films. The Rift was the most ridiculous (you can see my review of that). It's definitely one of the worst movies I've ever seen and Netflix gave it a 97% for me.This film just has a hackneyed plot, is poorly acted (except for John Cusack who is fine), and has really poor writing. You always know a story is going to suck when a voice over has to tell you what the story should be showing you.But seriously, Netflix, your algorithm used to be fairly decent. Now I feel like its trying to make me watch garbage and convince me to like it.

reviews.review_title: "You're the most dangerous thing that's ever existed. ...I'm leaving."
reviews.content: I don't understand all the negative reviews on here...I'm going to be a lot more charitable. Because it's obvious that the kids from the high school film class that somehow scored a hundred thousand dollar budget (and spent 98,000 of that on John Cusack) to do this class project have got enormous potential.

reviews.review_title: Chaotic, low-budget with a decent story.
reviews.content: Lately I've been seeing more and more sci-fi movies, which are actually a romantic dramas with a pretty standard Hollywoodish script. The only difference is, that these dramas are set in a sci-fi setting. Either in space, or far away in the future. In this movie, they had to pick. It was either going to be a pretty good sci-fi story, or a cheesy romance, exploited many times in Sci- Fi, but rarely touched in romantic movies. Well, they failed to decide so it turned out to be half decent Sci-fi plus half decent romantic story. And we all know that having two halves of different bills is not the same as having a single hundred-dollar bill.The story is not new, but still it could be a very pleasant sci-fi. It unfolded so quickly, that if we remove the romantic part, it could pass for a trailer. Music score was heavily influenced by Blade Runner, acting was pretty bad (Even John Cusack could not save it). Camera guy was still learning, CGI's were decent.They tried creating a huge movie with a dramatic story, set between among the stars. But to create such big thing, you need a lot of money. Obviously they did not have them and now it looks like a low- budget version of Star Gate. If they tried creating a 7-8 series out of this script, it could have had a huge success.

reviews.review_title: Interesting Concept, but the story & screenplay are not fully developed
reviews.content: The main element or concept presented by the story-writer of "Singularity" is interesting ; however , the story and screenplay have not been developed well enough to hold the viewers' attention from the beginning to the end of the movie. I do respect the story-writer for conveying an intriguing outlook at the future of human beings.The basic plot of "Singularity" revolves around John Cusack , Julian Schaffner , and Jeanine. Cusack plays the CEO of an organization that has developed a supercomputer which forecasts threats to the world and attempts to end all wars. The supercomputer identifies the humans themselves being the greatest threat to the world. Thus , robots are sent to kill all the human beings ; 97 years later, it is shown that a small group of humans still exist. Julian and Jeanine are the so-called "leaders" of this group , and they all are trying to find "the other world" to live , where their life will not be threatened by the robots.The performances of the cast can be analyzed in the range between mediocre to decent ; some were good , and some not that much. I understand it is not a very big budget movie , but the story needed full development to achieve critical and commercial success. I would love to become a story-writer for movies because I am really excellent at writing interesting, thrilling stories that can achieve critical and commercial super-success. Employers / Movie Studios can contact me at svhot34@gmail.com

Simply put, I can't grasp how this attempt at a film wasn't litigated against for, at the very least, cherry-picking the entirety of Terminator: Salvation's plot. Cash your check Cusack, while we sit back and laugh at your lack of integrity and creative impetus.

This movie is so bad I can't even justify taking the time to write a complete review. Besides it would take far too long to point out all the faults of this movie, but on the other hand it is easy to point out the positives. There are none.
... but it died very quick. All the bad comments are true.

Around 2020, Elias Van Dorne (John Cusack) has a company that produces military grade robots created by a super computer called Kronos for the purpose of ending all wars. His ultimate goal is for these robots to kill all humans because Elias has decided humans are the cancer that cause all the problems in the world. And this is done and world-wide wars break out all over and humans are killed off. Elias is obsessed with Arora - the last human strong- hold - but he doesn't know where it is, and he sees one human still alive and her name is Calia (Jeannine Wacker) and her purpose is to go to Arora. Elias makes a human machine called Andrew to befriend Calia so she will trust Andrew and take him with her to Arora. Then Elias will destroy it.Elias and his brother Damien (Carmen Argenziano) somehow encase themselves within Kronos and are able to live forever. (How is that possible?) Don't ask, it's complicated. Now 97-years later Elias watches Andrew and Calia travel to Arora. Along the way we see other humans but Elias has no interest in them, but only in Calia and her drive to find Arora.Well, this is certainly upsetting. Is this the end game for all of us? Debate among yourselves. What will Calia do when she learns that Andrew is a human machine? Remember, we were told earlier that even Andrew doesn't know.The only thing I have an issue with is the year that began all this and it should have been started much later than 2020 mostly because of the technology involved. See? (More complications?) Yes. Okay, more issues: If all humans have been killed off, where did Calia get what looked like new clothes? The buildings still standing looked well kept for the most part. ( Hey, remember that in a dream or now in a Sci-Fi movie anything is possible. Stop being so picky.)I cannot go any further without giving all away (There's more?) Yes, a lot more. A really big twist will happen and it surprised all of us. Stop it. You will never guess what it is. (Bummer)This is a very strange, creative, upsetting and can this really happen in time story? Again, debate among yourselves. (7/10)Violence: Yes. Sex: No. Nudity: No. Language: No.
Given it's the first feature this kid (the director) has made, I'll give it a five... no one really starts out at the top of their career. Probably funded it himself.
They spend 2 days together and have a bond strong enough for him to recode himself? I want that hour and a half back.
You can use this movie as a torturing device...waste off life.

reviews.review_title: Made it though 3/10 of the movie
reviews.content: watched 3/10 of the movie so 3/10 rating, not sure what else to say, wow, bad.Check out Birth of a Dragon. It's an awesome movie done in the style of a Bruce Lee movie, with Bruce Lee as a character. It's not a documentary, but instead a made up story about what might of happened when Bruce Lee and Jack Man butted heads :)Birth of Dragon was reviewed to hell by shills for the Bruce Lee estate. Ignore them.
How this spectacularly horrible movie has even a 4.2 rating is confounding; not one single redeeming facet to this movie at all.

reviews.review_title: So bad that it hurts, and not in a cult classic kind of way. If someone offers you $50 to watch it I would ask for a little more.
reviews.content: A numbingly familiar plot line is made to look better next to the abomination that is the 'Singularity's script, dialogue, and acting. It feels less like a movie and more like someone poorly edited together cliché snippets of dialogue from the most trite moments of similar movies. The soundtrack kept me on edge like Comcast customer service hold music. The pallid lighting together with John Cusack's makeup and cosmetic surgery do make him look fittingly non-human, but I think that was only coincidental. Julian Schaffner's performance will make you wonder what casting agent thought he was attractive enough to sleep his way into a role. On the other hand, the with other leading character, it is hard to tell if Jeannine Wacker's performance was consumingly terrible or just poor and struggling against vomit inducing directing and script writing. "And...surprised look: "Were you awake just then!?" ...cut" The CGI was surprisingly palatable, to those artists; i'm sorry you had to work on this film. I'm even more sorry if you had to attend the premiere only to see your pretty decent work be mixed in with the rest of this cinematic excrement. To give you perspective; I have written and posted my only review ever here since there were none on RT just to save others from being tricked by a popular actor's name into thinking this is a watchable movie. If you like the Walking Dead or War of the Worlds but wished they were more like After Earth and a bucket of poop written by a lazy AI program that strings together movie clichés with poor scene cuts; then you will love this film. I can't wait for a decent movie with an actual focus on the singularity to come along so that this movie can be differentiated as 'Singularity (2017, poop)'. The only redeemable part of the movie is the end when you see that they are setting it up for a sequel, which will give you a good laugh because someone could have actually watched the finished product and still thought a sequel could possibly ever be funded or made.

reviews.review_title: This movie is an embarrassment to the genre
reviews.content: This has to be a student project. Weak story, horrific acting, 1st year film student level special effects. John Cusack must have owed someone a favor.

reviews.review_title: Oh just bad. Waste of time.
reviews.content: I was a little mad when I finished the movie that I could have spent that time watching literally any other movie. It's really bad. Would not recommend. I could go into why but basically I'm here to tell you don't waste your time. Watch something else. Sorry. But also you're welcome.
Apparently Kronos didn't kill the barbers because Andrew has a pretty fresh haircut.

reviews.review_title: A series of clichés stitched together with bad CGI
reviews.content: There's nothing good in this. At times it felt like the makers were doing it on purpose. Night scenes always had a hooting owl for example. The script was bad, the acting is bad, the CGI is bad and anything that isn't completely bad is s straight copy from other films.

I cannot believe I just wasted 1:32 minutes of my life watching this garbage. The acting was abysmal, the script awful and the special effects and props just pathetic. I feel sorry for an actor like John Cusack being reduced to playing in C movies, never mind B movies! If you have not seen it yet, please don't waste your time. Trust me!
Bad just bad. I watched it cause it was interesting to see how much worse it could get.

reviews.review_title: Worst Terminator (& Terminator Salvation) ripoff ever
reviews.content: Warmonger computer expert creates Artificial Intelligence Kronos. Kronos sees humans as threat & robots wipe out humans. 93 years later, A.I. of the warmonger creates a cyborg, Andrew, who thinks he's human. Andrew meets girl Calia when she saves his life ... repeatedly. She's looking for Aurora, a legendary city where humans are safe from machines. Andrew doesn't know he was created to destroy Aurora - we are told this in cut to warmonger A.I. explaining this to his "brother" A.I.Ripoff plot but in case you never saw Terminator, plot is given away by expository narration and dialogue in a ridiculous case of tell-before-show.Same plot and character names as 2015 movie Aurora. I didn't see Aurora, only a trailer then movie apparently wasn't released in the U.S. I don't know if Aurora was any better.

reviews.review_title: Rise of machines with ultimate judgement day.........
reviews.content: In many thoughts this movie is a combined idea of Terminator the Rise of machines and the judgement day. Only the time machine part of terminator is absent here. It also starts with the applied use of a supercomputer to control human beings. But as we know the machines always rise above the humans it is also not an exception. Although many audience find boring to see these type of robotics Sci-Fi as they all share a more or less common idea. The first part of that belongs to the Machines and their domination and the second part reflects the fight back of man. This Sci-fi also goes in the same orbit. But some things are different here. It is more concern with human bondage and it lacks of heavy machinery apparatus that frequently unloads the movie. It has made a good combination of action and slow rising tensions between computer and the survivors of human being..So you will not find the movie as only a sci-fi rather it is a mixture of drama, romance and hardwares and softwares also.Those who like to see Robotics Sci-fi will enjoy it surely. The Terminator series..Ex machina..Blade runner..Robo cop...Cyborg..is these are liked by you then you are the candidate for this movie...Rest of all i am not sure.

Everything about this film is truly depressingly bad-which is a shame as amongst the mess are some interesting ideas. At least Jeannine Wacker can act, but the rest of the cast? Ouch. I'm not sure who JC was thinking, and the male lead looked like he'd just stumbled out of acting school (after failing). Avoid.

I thoroughly enjoyed this film. It is a happy exception to the fact that there is no such thing as a good sci-fi movie. Sure, it's a far out story --- a computer takes over the world --- but many sci-fi classics (books, not movies) have spun even wilder ideas. I can see why the story line might daunt people who don't read science-fiction (my wife, for example, reviled it). But for those of us who do, it was quite in line. There were no gross fallacies or questionable science. Not a classic like 2001. But still a decent evening for anybody who enjoys Bradbury, Asimov and Clarke.

Although there are some imperfections in this movie, and it's true that John Cusack is not convincing in his role, overall it's not a bad movie.I enjoyed the visual effects, and some of the acting was very good, especially by Jeannine Wacker as Calia.

reviews.review_title: Ok I know my rating is high
reviews.content: Not a great movie I grant you all but I was in a good mood watching it so I have it a 6/10 because I love these types of movies and I thought the cgi was pretty good! It does need a proper story and better directing but for a Saturday afternoon viewing it was ok. John Cusack sure looked awful in that weird wig but he was an AI so perhaps he shouldn't come off as too human. Many story flaws already described in other reviews...but I do want to add that they showed each house had a robot butler which could account for the homes being kept nice although yes they didn't show them still there cleaning. Many flaws but I kinda enjoyed it.

reviews.review_title: Either a joke or rather an insult to SciFi movies
reviews.content: The only interesting part of this movie is its title. Rest: weak copy of the Terminator, where you really wonder how could John Cusack give his name to it.

reviews.review_title: Ignore the reviews, this is a solid four!
reviews.content: I know you've seen fake 10 star reviews, and plenty of 1 star reviews to offset them. But the happy result is it ended up a 4, right where it should be.Bottom line - A movie with an ending meant for a sequel, but you don't really want to see the sequel.

So, for the story of skynet that has been said, this attempts the same spin, same as iRobot, no need to waste time like I did. I wished however, they would let some real graphic folks take over for the 2nd one, because oh god forbid there will be a f*king sequel.The art work was shittier than "star Wreck in the Pirkining" which I consider the best movie made on a 14000Euro budget.

reviews.review_title: Save an hour and just watch Terminator....much better than this!
reviews.content: I watched it because it had John Cusack in it...boy was I wrong to waste my time by watching the entire show. I always think that a movie will have at least some redeeming qualities but this one really disappointed. VERY slow and the script had to be written by a teenager because the dialogue was boring and very predictable. Come on John!...you don't have to star in movies like this, you're better than that!In the end it was a mix between Terminator and iRobot, just not in a good way. Even for a poorly scripted movie you always hope at least one of the characters steps up and brings a little light to the stage...not in this movie. All the actors, including John deliver performances that equal high school drama. (Trying hard but not pulling it off...) I generously gave it 3 stars since the computer CGI was fairly decent and the robotic machines looked pretty good. At least the animation guys did their job!

Just awful on so many levels. The story seems to have been written by a 10 year old, who spent their weekend watching dystopian movies. It contains every movie trope played with over the last 18 years. There's a little Hunger Games, a little Terminator Judgement Day, and Salvation, and a hint of Maze Runners. You have a teenage girl falling for teenage boy, running around woods a lot. The movie is set 97 years after "judgement day", the day Kconos the A.I. woke-up and destroyed all of human civilization. Yet, the kids look they just picked up their clothes at the Mall. They also find all kinds of neat manufactured things that look and work like they're brand new, not a century old. For example the Polaroid Camera they stumble on, which not only takes perfect instant picture (loaded with film...that's still good), but apparently the battery has stayed powered up for a 100 years to operate the flash. ...amazing.The acting and dialogue were cringeworthy. There were so many plot holes it was insulting. I truly feel bad for everyone associated with this film, but especially for John Cusack, what the hell was he thinking signing on to this project. I hope he was at least paid well. Then I found out that the original film was actually shot back in 2013, all the parts with John Cusack in it were filmed and added years later. This was a crappy movie, that someone tried to reedit in order to make it more marketable. ....swing and a miss....That explains a lot about the choppy continuity errors. This was a hack job. What's more laughable is this movie ended with a set-up for a sequel. What the hell, did they really think this POS was going to become the next Hunger Games or something?It's a shame really. I like dystopian science fiction, especially playing with the idea of A.I.. But this wasn't even a near miss. Don't waste your time.

This is another in a long line of human-hate stories. This time, it's robots that find the human race to be a disease. At least the dialog in the original Kingsman was well written and interesting, and Samuel L. Jackson's loathing of his own species was entertaining. Here, the dialog is uneven, often predictable, and frequently not well grounded in character motivation. The female lead is rightfully cautious, at first, but then stupidly, (spoiler!) suddenly trusting.Other story elements were poorly conceived. The male lead's dream sequences were awkward. And his real identity was used in the story with ham-handed clumsiness not making the most of its potential for building suspense.Will Smith's After Earth seemed to have a similar "bad humans" theme -- humanity messing up Earth -- but the acting and dialog in that movie were far better than this.Hollywood seems to be playing it up to the eugenicist globalists and their "perfect" world order. After watching this movie, I just wanna puke. Maybe I can find an heroic oldie to wash this tired filth from my mind.Too often, any more, movies are becoming a real letdown. And of all the movies I've seen this year, this one ranks near the bottom. Can't believe it even has 5 stars. Can't believe Cusack was desperate enough to work on this. I hope Hollywood wakes up and starts writing less victim-hood and human-hate nonsense and gets back to writing smart, uplifting and powerful stories that inspire.

Bad movie, don't waste time. I read some reviews and now I am positive IMDb has fake reviews. Not sure how much extra money the film makers get by putting effort into boosting ratings untruthfully but it would be nice if they just made a movie to be proud about. Bad acting and bad cgi. Only thing good is the baseline of the story.

reviews.review_title: Came here just to warn others
reviews.content: Came to IMDB for the sole purpose of rating this horrible mess of a movie. The worst dialogue and delivery. Cusack needs an intervention. Even he managed to be as horrible as the other actors, which wasn't an easy job. Truly cringeworthy in every respect.

reviews.review_title: NOT a John Cusack movie at all, because he is only starring in it for a few minutes. The rest is rubbish. RUBBISH
reviews.content: NOT worth of being called a movie. This is a cheaply produced tv movie, with C list actors, with NO charisma.More bad: there is really NO thrill or suspense whatsoever.Come on John Cusack, you can star in better pictures than this one!

Just to say it out loud and clear ; 'Don't watch that movie.It's a total waste of your valuable time.The story is none to nothing.....oh! We have an AI that's killing all the humans on the planet....seems to me that movie makers are stuck in an eternal loop of the same 'sh...'.And then there was the acting....oh my god.....it was so awfully bad.Julian Schaffner should stop acting and start a career at MC Donald's....would be better for him and for us.Don't let you fool by the rating.....believe me just don't watch it.!!

To be fair, this movie starts well. VA Industries, owned by Elias Van Dorne (Cusack) has improved the quality of life for people by developing exceptional robotic help. This is countered by the development of robots which fight in place of regular human soldiers and the loss of human life has been too great. Racked with guilt, Elias has been developing Kronos, the first truly artificial intelligence which will analyse the Earth and the human interaction in order to make it a better place.Oops! Kronos determines that humans are the biggest threat and begins to wipe out the human race with its machines... SkyNet much?Humans are forced to live in shelters underground and forage for supplies.We see the life of Andrew Davis and his mother who is clearly ill. Then the title "97 years later".Andrew emerges from an underground shelter, looking exactly as he did all those years ago... At this point, the plot is given away. Supported by the "no food for me" scene later in the movie.With Katniss, sorry, Calia a survivor he meets on his travels, he is looking for a fabled human safe haven called Aurora.Calia gives voiceovers to advance the lumbering plot, sounding like Sarah Connor in T2.All the while there are cutaways to Elias and another man Damian Walsh (Argenziano) who appear to be controlling things...--O--When you learn that this was originally a low budget movie, you begin to wonder why anyone went to all the trouble of adding CGI FX, scripting for Cusack and Argenziano and then re-tooling the movie.As a low-budget indie, it was probably going to get good reviews although not stellar. It falls between a high school movie project and someone shooting a movie for the first time. It's evident in the acting of the two young leads. I don't know how much of the CGI was original to the movie and what was added later.Some of the CGI is obvious (when the robot chases them towards the exit) , some of the CGI is not bad.The movie nods to too many others in the SF genre and comes up short.Adding Cusack could only have been to make it appeal to his fan base but it didn't appeal to me. His acting was wooden and expressionless. And Carmen Argenziano appeared normal at the beginning of the movie but then was given CGI make up with a white eye and a glowing head.As others have mentioned, the availability of hair dyes, reasonably good clothing after 97 years of no factory output or sources of food - even tinned food doesn't last that long - means many plot holes remain like open sores.It's 92 minutes of your life you won't get back. Although it still beats Jupiter Ascending.

reviews.review_title: Waste of acting talent and your time!
reviews.content: The overall idea would have been intriguing...with a completely different screenplay. The plot was very flimsy with major plotholes (kind of like a pothole but with..well, you get the idea). I wouldn't recommend this movie to anyone, it is a waste of time. There are some actors in this that are good, or used to be..looking at you John Cusack (maybe just stick to comedy or retire).

What a terrible script.. it starts off so choppy with the most cliched dialogue and plot ever (and that continues throughout the whole movie), no lead into what should be a devastating action scene, and no emotion to back it up. Hilarious product placement. Cusack is the only actor in the film that we know can act, but he doesn't act in this. They don't even bother buttoning up his suit properly, and then it cuts back to him with it buttoned. I was really sad to see him in this; it's a real low-point. He must really be in debt or something to be willing to embarrass himself like this. I would not be in this, and I've made a lot less money in my life than him!

I slept through a lot of this film as it failed to grab my attention from the start. The bits that I did see managed to combine being predictable with being pedestrian.This plot has been done before and far better and I rather wish I'd watched a Terminator instead. There were a few nice (but fairly low budget) effects, but not enough to offset all that wooden acting.

reviews.review_title: I made an account just to give this movie 1 star
reviews.content: I like "bad" movies. Hausu (1977), The Wicker Man (2006), The Room (2003), etc. They're a lot of fun! I also like "good" movies, of course, and in fact I *USED* to place movies into three general categories on a scale: good good, mediocre but not bad enough to be enjoyable, and so bad they're good. This movie has enlightened me to something.. beyond this, like UV rays or a negative number. It has crashed through the floor of my scale like a demonic Great Glass Elevator yeeting itself down to hell. The cursed fourth category of goodness/badness, 'so bad it's beyond being fun, I'm not having a good time, I want to go home, Mom.' I watched this movie months ago and I still just.. think about it every now and then, and how phenomenally god awful it is. So I'm here today giving this rating mostly for my own therapeutic help.The first red flag I noticed about this movie was that the lead female character looked like one of those knock off costumes you might find in a pop up Halloween store, but for Katniss Everdeen. It would probably be labeled "Sad Braid Forest Tween." The second thing I noticed was the acting, or lack thereof. In fact after a couple minutes of what I can quite accurately describe as the worst acting to ever grace my eyeballs, I had to pause the movie and spend MULTIPLE minutes googling whether or not this was a real movie, and not a satire. Another reviewer here describes the main male character as having two expressions, and I'd say that's pretty accurate. I'd label them, 'confused', and 'confused with bigger eyes.' As for Sad Braid Forest Tween, she spends about half of her time melodramatically sighing, making crying sounds and faces but somehow completely tearlessly, and being completely useless. Now at this point in the movie we've met John Cusack, and I'm not quite all the way down the rabbit hole of terror, so seeing a relatively big name gives me hope! Maybe this'll get better! Or, maybe it'll be funny how bad it is! Oh, how wrong I was... in retrospect, hope was cruel.For flag number... I don't even remember what, we get to see what civilization is like after 97 years. And it's.. immaculate! Everything is clean! That bag of chips someone left out almost a century ago are probably still fresh as far as this movie is concerned! Other than that there's the confusingly placed images of burned buildings and ivy encapsulating walls, which seem to appear and disappear all willy nilly. In fact the continuity continues to prove itself so bad that it's break-the-fourth-wall distracting. Well, I say distracting, but there is absolutely NO plot development from which to actually distract. Just... nothing... happening. Eventually they tease out the ever-so-original plot that an edgelord supercomputer built for peace decides to kill humans. It's about now that I begin to lose my sense of reality. There is no now, or then, or here. Nothing makes sense. Everything is nothing and nothing is everything. Honestly I'm pretty sure I started to dissociate by the time they got aboard the spaceship. Which, by the way, is where upon our store-brand duo learn that they can either stay on earth and likely die from evil robots, or take off in a spaceship to the rumored new home for humans, and therein LEAD ALL OF THE EVIL ROBOTS TO AURORA, THE LAST REMAINING BASTION OF THE HUMAN SPECIES, WHEREBY EVERYONE WILL DIE FROM EVIL ROBOTS. Can you guess what they chose? I'll give you a hint, it rhymes with shmead all of the shmevil shmobots to shmaurora.I did learn afterwards that the parts of the movie that have John Cusack were added several years after filming for the rest of it was done. I still can't decide if I'm more flabbergasted by the fact that they legit originally just decided that was a whole and finished movie, or that they thought adding all that crap with John Cusack was a going to help it. I left this movie a changed woman. Never before would I have thought it possible to hate a movie so much, and I spent actual money to see Mama Mia in theaters. The credits finished rolling and I was still sitting on my couch, glassy-eyed and re-evaluating all of my life choices that lead me to this absolute eldritch abomination of a film. I have seen the devil. His name is Singularity.Thanks for coming to my TED talk.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I've seen in recent years
reviews.content: I won't waste your or my time by writing a long review, but let me just state that it's horrible in pretty much every aspect. Especially the acting is probably the worst I've ever seen. Stay away people, stay away! The main "star" John Cusack has maybe two minutes worth of screen time by the way. Yes, it's one of those BS movies.

I tend to trust "some" imdb scores. But lately this has proven wrong.So, now i try movies in the mid-range. When i watched this it was sill passing 5 stars. Now i can agree with other reviewers that complain about tons of 9-star ratings with no review.The story was dull. Don't get me wrong. I like post-apocalyptic themes, and technology stuff. However, i want a least a vague sense of plausibility when tackling the theme.This movie tries to go into Terminator territory. AI gone crazy, and deciding to exterminate humans. That's just the introduction, there is no explanation not development on that. You have to witness the AI kill humankind and then skip forward 97 years. (why not 100?).And then, the story revolves around 2 novice actors. Novice as in "they can't act". It is awful. I've seen best acting in street comedy. The "old" actors (Carmen Argenziano and John Cusack) and like they are not convinced. . I can pass that up.
Then there is the FX. It is BAD. I don't require great FX for a good movie, but c'mon. At least try. Most current games look more realistic.But then i return to the story. And that i cannot forgive. It is boring. The lines are tedious and repetitive. You could guess what was going to happen or was going to be said. I won't spoil the movie. But it keeps on going. It is boring, dull, and tiring. Other movies, with less money, unknown actors, had brilliant scripts, and kept me engaged. I feel this movie will bore you as it bored me, so PLEASE .... Skip it. You can go watch Terminator, and even if you don't really like it, you will be more entertain with the action.

reviews.review_title: Easiest money John Cusack ever made
reviews.content: Awful is an understatement for this movie. Cusack literally stands or sits in one spot the entire movie. He looks strung out, too. The whole thing just doesn't make any sense. He's monitoring the two main characters (the most generic, boring male protagonist in recent memory and a blatant Catniss Everdeen ripoff. Seriously, it's not even subtle) the entire movie. He looking at images of them from directly in front of them, eye level, and all around. One shot is a close up. I mean, how is he getting these images without a camera? Or are the two main characters completely oblivious? The whole thing is laughable. The funniest thing to me is the ending is an absolute set up for a sequel. There's no way in seven hells that this should have a sequel greenlit.

This is just awful...weak story, weak SFX, weak characters...Now I have to come up with more to say about this...There are some idiotic plot twists but above all the CGI is so bad it breaks any immersion possible. now if this were some student thesis film with graphics made on a laptop I could understand but how bad is John Cusack's Alcohol problem if he let this piece of rubbish have his name on it...

What is John Cusack thinking allowing his name to be on this? The script is just beyond laughable, the plot is so full of holes you have to make ten assumptions within the first ten minutes. As for the acting, jeezus, Jeannine Wacker the leading lady was all over the place, in some place it looks like she's on acid watching a game of table tennis, in other places she showed as much emotion in her face as a Red Setter.
All in all it lies with Robert Kouba the writer and director you may say, but no, it lies with the flamin' eejuts who supplied the money to make it. I'd love to be able to put some of the dialogue in and some observations but dear reader you would not believe. Watch it stoned is all I'll say, oh go on I'll give you one bit of dialogue, "wild berries had no flavour anymore".

It says more about John Cusack's career than anything else that he's punched out around 10 minutes of acting on a green screen to give this thing some cred. The writer director had success in the short film market - who doesn't - but can't maintain the rage, much less the conceptual content past the 15 minute mark. With too many references to other movies, there is hardly one original idea here. You sort of hope that in this nice looking but otherwise wretched thing there is some hope - perhaps it is a movie about the human condition, or the potential down side of AI, or - who really cares... The production values are good - very good - and that is what kept me watching to the end, but the dialog, story and concepts are ordinary, a blend of things you've seen and sad...in that order. I have a very simple scoring system - under 5 is some variation of I wish I'd seen something better - 6 is good, 7 is i'd recommend and above that we're moving into the great movies - this is a 4.5 - I rounded up because i'd seen some good movies this week.

reviews.review_title: 5 cent acting and directing, good CGI.
reviews.content: You can't like any of the characters. All the actors talk slow and confused, or panicky with clearly fake intention. All the lines are cliche.The CGI robot in the beginning is modelled very well except for a fixed happy grin in a scene where it's at home. This is alarming to the viewer but there's no "pick up" on it. There are actors in the scene but they are purposefully acting in an unimportant way, so you don't care, which makes the whole scene confusing and pointless.None of the leads act according to the scenes. The master robot builder acts in a mysterious way when talking to his "creation". In reality if he really put work into it - more than any other person alive - he would know everything in an "of course" manner, not be in a wandering god delusion.The other leads act in a similar wandering god delusion or a panic. Then deliver cliche lines.
Awful movie. Squeaky clean teens wander through post apocalyptic landscape. Terrible special effects, weak story.
I wouldn't bother watching this, it will only hert ! In as much you'll never come to terms with yourself for allowing yourself to watch it till the end . Utter Rubbish.

Just plain bad acting, almost robotic, except for the robot character which was terribly over-acted with poorly expressed melodrama. The storyline is so thin its about as interesting as Cusak's singular deadpan expression on the face of the character he portrays. Virtually impossible to watch this lousy presentation straight through, I gave up after two longsuffering sessions making it to the 1:18 mark, not engaged in the slightest; don't know or care how it ends.

This movie is just bad. It has a similar plot to Terminator-Salvation, just less believable. Yes that's right Terminator-Salvation has less plot holes and better character development. Acting is just plain bad. For 97 years after the apocalypse everyone seems pretty naive about survival skills. 
It's a waste of time.

reviews.review_title: A 22 years old director's first film with $100,000 budget
reviews.content: Indeed it could have been better, but come on, it is just an amateur effort of a young fellow on a miniscule budget.

I stay to it, i broke the movie up! After less then 30 Minutes.
Reason:
Plot says already much, including the whole beginning of the Movie...
Rest is told in much reviews. Complete unlogik things... a Smartphone who seems, never running Power out..
That Bow thing ( sorry i have simple Boykottet the whole Tribute of Panem, because they are for me a Hollywood cleaned up Versions of Battle Royale series ) .But my reason or breaking up the Movie is:
Singularity is nothing else then a Hidden new version of the Movie " Logans Run " where this time, the Boy is himself a robot who dont knows it ( remembers from Star Trek... and other Movies / Series ) . With added Version of Big Brother.
That was simple too much. Whole thing ended in... 1 Teen Bot + 1 Girl on Run to find " Lost Paradise " on the run from mashines.... Observed by deffinetly too 2 Old Robots.

This could have been great but isn't..CGI do not a good movie make.Many of the scenes have been copied from other SciFi films.It started well but quickly became just two teenagers running around - yawn.

I wouldn't say it's a terrible movie but it's definitely a stinker. I was really surprised how bad the movie was considering it had John cusack, who was in some good movies like Con Air, and Carmen Argenziano, who was in The Godfather II. What happened to them? Are we going to see them in bladder leakage commercials next?The story has a lot of holes in it. I would think if a robot can't see you hiding behind a dresser they should be pretty easy to kill. And to what end was the plan? Destroy humans so he can lay in a coma forever? No other plan? This movie left me with more questions than answers by the end. I had to laugh at the robot guy. He only has two expressions, stoic or so terrified that his eyes are popping out of his head.If you're home for a week with the flu and you've watched every other movie and this is all you have left then give it a shot. Otherwise there's many other movies worth your time.

This is an awful movie. It has no redeeming features. Full of plot holes which totally debase the premise, with second rate special effects and wooden acting. The story is predictable down to minutiae - at one point I said, to my son, 'I hope this doesn't come down to him punching a robot' and the very next second, out of nowhere, the protagonist punches a robot. What John Cusack was doing in this movie is a mystery, but even his performance was lacklustre. I streamed this but wish I hadn't bothered.

reviews.review_title: another potentially 7*** movie that i gave only 3*** ...
reviews.content: Another potentially 7*** movie that i gave only 3*** for the same reason that i've done a similar thing to quite a number of other movies as well: the plot is already so flawed that good cinematography and even fine acting and direction can't cover, or at least let us ignore the mistakes!mistakes? yes ... for example, what's the young girl's history when we do have a madeup history for the young Andrew-id? how come the super duper Kronos 'war machine' didn't succeed to eliminate all humanity after 97 years of brutal and systematic slaughtering of people? how did some humans manage to escape their doomed fate and reach another solar system by the year 2020 if their technology was so advanced by then but they couldn't stay on Earth and fight Kronos right there? and the list goes on ...the other thing that has always bothered me so badly in some scifi movies since i was a very young child is that how some demigod or evil being can see what people do miles or even continents away from a camera angle on the ground and so close to the characters (sometimes the camera is actually panning or tracking too!) while the human subjects cannot see such a 'floating' camera filming them right in front of their own faces? if the camera is 'invisible', well, then the evil demigod owning such a magical 'all-seeing eye' technology must surely be able to do more to those character it's chasing with such cameras, right? (for example, the camera can be equipped with a gun as well and blast away the man or woman it's chasing ... why not?)

reviews.review_title: Not an original idea in the entire movie
reviews.content: First 5 minutes..........the earth is infected, to save it, we must.....Bet every single person that reads this can guess exactly where the plot is going. A variation of you have to cruel to be kind.I used to think John Cusack was a decent, journeyman actor, but he either did thia without reading the script, as a favor to someone........or he is desperate for a paycheck.Watch this, only if its on the one chanel you receive. If you get 2 chanels, watch the other one., It is that bad. Oh one equivocation, if you have never seen a sci fi movie, it might be passable. Might?

reviews.review_title: John Cusack's career has jumped the shark
reviews.content:
I watched this because of John Cusack. He has been in some interesting movies. So many holes in this story. So many jr high play "what's my line" pauses. So many inconsistencies. Fight scenes made WWE look real. 
2 minutes in I wondered what am I watching. I watched for another 30 min to let it develop, but then realized this is simply bad and getting worse. Could not believe it had a 4 rating. 4 says it has some promise. This a Singularity turd deserving of a single star.

This seems like a movie for kids. Like an after school special. I'm talking 8 to 15 years oldThere is no profanity, sex or nudity. There is violence. But no gore or torture.Adults could watch it with children. But I don't think adults would want to watch it alone.

Just no. I made an account only to say NO. I have watched movies to kill time a million times that have no plot, budget or cgi. This movie is Terminator Salvation, if everyone on the crew was in a highschool AV club.

reviews.review_title: Makes Ed Wood look like Cecil B. DeMille
reviews.content: This is the worst movie I've ever watched. I won't waste any more time even on the review other than to say it's awful in every way.

I am a sci-fi junkie and have a high tolerance for grade B fare. I have been kind to many sci-fi movies that have received far fewer stars by others than I have given them.But yes, this movie is incredibly bad. I gave it two stars instead of one because, oh, I don't know...it is in color instead of black and white? I want to say that the ghost of Ed (Plan 9 From Outer Space) Wood must have had a hand in it's production. But that would be an insult to Ed Wood.And to think that the ending was set up for a sequel if not a continuing series. As if that was ever going to happen. (Does this count as a spoiler? Could this movie be any more spoiled already anyway?) Who in their right minds green-lighted this first (and last) one to begin with?And what's up with those batteries still working in that ancient Polaroid Land Camera? They must be well over 100 years old. Could I please have them for my smartphone?

The idea: good. But the realisation and the details: bad.Look, there is a girl 97 years after the distinction. She wears nice tight fitting jeans and a spotless tank-top. Not to mention her technical equipment and a top-notch crossbow in tactical black, of course. 97 years after the event she must be 3rd or 4th generation of people without access to technology and power in general. And did I mention that she basically looks like Katniss Everdeen...?And then there is Kronos and his brother. Two humans living on in or as AIs burdening them themselves with a human appearance and communicating via human speech. I understand that some actors can attract viewers, but come on! You could have done better, more innovative.And yes: In 2020 there are obviously batteries able to store energy for 97 years after the last recharge. Only 2 years to go! Verdict: Not worth the time. And be warned there is a cliffhanger at the end threatening us with a part 2...

Even the cool battlemechs can't pull this one out of being a smoldering dungpile. The two leads were obviously cast because they looked good not because they had even a sliver of talent. And to compound it they give the female lead, who delivers her lines with the skill a second grade school play flower, voice-over responsibility. And yes, the results are painful to listen to. Oh, John Cusack stops in to pick up a paycheck, not act, as well. Watching this makes The 100 feel like a high concept scifi masterpiece.

Slow, boring, bad acting, mediocre special effects. John Cusack and Carmen Argenziano could not save this train wreck. The romance is tacky, the characters are not interesting, the suspense is non-existent and the plot-twist in the end is not very original. The three points are for a few cool giant robots. This movie really ruined my mood.

reviews.review_title: A study guide in "How NOT To"
reviews.content: This production is an interesting premise in search of a bigger budget, better writing, better direction, better acting, better effects.....you get the idea. The basic concept is not new - think "Skynet" in the "Terminator" series - but the twist is worth exploring. Unfortunately it's not executed very well here. However this is a good movie to watch and make notes on what not to do when making a movie.

The special effects were surprisingly good. But the "script" and "acting" were, well, kinda bad. Ridiculous, convoluted story that made little sense, with elements ripped off from Terminator, Walking Dead, The Road, and a few B-grade sci-fi movies. And John Cusack...well, he must have needed the money. Maybe someday he'll be in something respectable again.

If you have watched The Matrix, Terminator, Hunger Games or Bladerunner then do yourself a favor and just watch one of those movies instead. The only "good" thing about this movie is that someone was able to pitch a good enough sales pitch to have someone produce this POS. The acting is beyond horrible and straight out of something you would expect from an Asylum ripoff, and I'm pretty sure John Malkovich just took his check and never looked back.
Avoid. Watch Terminator or better yet read a real article on the actual threat of singularity. Its scarier than this trash fire.

reviews.review_title: "Terminator" at "Bladerunner" speed, written by the writers from "Lost".
reviews.content: "Terminator" at "Bladerunner" speed, written by the writers from "Lost". The result; robots want to kill all humans, boringly slow, and nothing makes sense. 97 years after humanity is wiped out, there have apparently been huge scientific developments which made it possible to make and launch a star-fleet without being discovered, and with minimum staff. The robots really should use IR to track the leftover humans. Sattelites would also be useful, as would drones. Big, clunky walkers?: not so much. Also, if you're being hunted by killer robots it might be wise to lose the GPS-amulet you're wearing. Oh, wait!: only her special receiver can trace the signal. As i said: nothing makes sense.
Awesome movie! But it really deserves a sequel or/and book

reviews.review_title: On your marks, get set, TERRIBLE!
reviews.content: I occasionally intentionally watch a bad movie just for fun. This took the fun out of that fun! Do you believe in miracles? I do now because it's a miracle that this ever made it past being a script. Can't wait for the sequel!!!

reviews.review_title: It's as if someone tried to turn his visual effects reel into a feature film
reviews.content:
This movie is inept on almost every level--except one.The story is a nonsensical hash of ideas lifted from other, better movies.
The acting and direction are terrible.
The dialogue is laughable.The only thing about it that's any good is the visual effects. Some of them are quite cool.I can see how a movie this bad gets made. There's one person credited with the script, directing and even the editing of the film. One Robert Goupa. So you can see how one person might become invested in this idea and lose sight of how awful it is.What's s hard to believe that anyone would finance such an obviously terrible script. I can only guess that the people who put money into it must have believed that the effects would somehow carry the day.

So most of mankind is wiped out by a crazed tech inventor and his creation, Kronos. Pick up the story 97 years later. Ok, so when the characters cross an old railroad track in the woods, there's no 97-year overgrowth. Searching through an old home, not a speck of dust or cobwebs to be seen. Are the machines mowing the grass? Dusting the houses?Who thought this film through? Aren't there production people that set up a scene for a shoot? I think they were out that day, the entire shooting schedule. I'm fairly certain most 2nd year film student could have done better.Bad, just bad

Take the Hunger Games, Terminator, War of the Worlds and all the Matrix. Nick all the ideas, add John Cusack not acting and do a film really badly.Skynet wakes up, kills all humanity, turns John Cusack into a crap actor, creates an AI boy 97 years later to find the rebel camp and kill the remaining humans.THAT'S never been done before.Actually it has and done well.This however....
Was it scripted or just ad-lib?If you bear it just last 45 minutes when a fully working Kodak Instamatic is used. Fully functioning 97 years after the eradication of humans. 97 mind you, not 100.

I realize that Cusack is middle aged and the cutesy underdog boy-next-door parts are in the rearview, but, damn! 
So many flaws. It was like a cheap SciFy movie of the week from 20 yrs ago.....
The movie is over after the "I don't eat scene"......
I only made it about half way in, dunno, maybe you can do better. 
If I've said it once, I've said it, like, 67 or 68 times,"F, CGI, it's ruining movies!" Are writers that exspensive these days? Oh, and Nexflix, sling some more of this, maybe some will stick.

reviews.review_title: I suspect this could have been a good, even great movie if only...
reviews.content: ...if it had come to a different director and producer.I can totally see the unrealized potential in this terrible, disjointed mess of a film. Why on Earth Nicolas Cage decided to add his face to this mess is beyond me, but lately he has made so many bizarre choices it doesn't really surprise me.

reviews.review_title: Too many Haters (dont understand their negativity)
reviews.content: I rated this movie a 7 as I was rating a C rate movie that was shared on You tube. I based my rating on a movie that plays out like a made for TV movie that would play on Sy Fy. I though it did rather well for a first time collaboration of a director, producer whom prior to this production had only did short films or commercials. The special effects were rather well for the robots and space craft. It was not a waste of time to watch, and I suggest others watch this film to see a first movie that will truly turn into better movies still to come. I look forward to a sequel or some other science fiction that this director pushes out.
Painful to watch. I had to turn it off at 15 minutes and 43 seconds. It really is that bad. Shame on you John Cusack.

Yes it is very low budget and yes the script is cheesy but I can honestly say I enjoyed it. I watch alot of these low budget movies and this one isnt as bad as most reviews claim.
I'd be willing to bet that most people who left negative reviews didnt finish the movie.
I can't believe I wasted 1 1/2 hours of my life on this. You know a movie is bad when halfway through it you're just waiting for it to be over. This movie has no redeeming qualities whatsoever.

What if after so much selfishness, haltered, lie & deceit, the A. I (Cronos) considered humans "plague" of the planet while doing so much for them, then what did they wrong, logically? Expecting second part of the movie! Yes, there are some lacks in acting but the writer & director did their part best!
Beautiful visuals, wonderful but overbearing score. Full of plot holes. Last ten minutes were enjoyable.

This movie actually had alot of potential. They could have done something with this idea but they instead decided to make a very generic and nonsensical movie that goes nowhere. They could have at least did a M. Night Shymalan and added a twist or something. It wouldn't have cost them a dime to write a better script but instead they decided to waste their money on getting John Cusack to say some lines after they were already done filming. Overall if you are reading this wondering whether you should watch this movie, I would say you should only watch it if you are planning on making fun of it with friends. The characters are laughably bad and once again the movie goes nowhere.

reviews.review_title: Swiss should stick to hiding Nazi gold
reviews.content:
All you clowns you have downloaded illegally films music...
And this is what left so thanks

If the writer had given his plot to a sci/fi writer and a solid producer, who would in turn get a decent budget, director and actors (Good CGI), then maybe this could have been a decent movie. Instead it's a one man ego fest. I love the idea of AI going wrong, because within the last year we were introduced to the first true AI (AlphaZero). The timeline of this plot foundation fits it , just as ex machina's plot foundation of the world's greatest search engine company creating the first AI (Google created AlphaZero) With AlphaZero and Space Force converging at the same time, I see exciting and perhaps frightening things ahead. Hollywood needs to come up with some fresh ideas regarding AI to keep up.

reviews.review_title: dont waste your time watching this movie- to many plot holes to count
reviews.content:
So many plot holes and very bad um cgi.
97 yrs pass, amazing how clean the actors look. makeup/nice clothes, shoes. 
love John Cusack, but buddy, um why did u do this film. need money?
don't waste your time on this movie.
This is some of the worst acting I've have seen in some time. The story line is awful. Why John C would agree to this movie, I haven't a clue. I get he is taking his cue from Nicholas Cage.

The special effects actually didn't seem so bad to me...
But everything else was absolutely horrible. I couldn't even make it through the first half hour it was so bad, and none of it made any sense whatsoever. I don't understand why this movie even exists.

reviews.review_title: This could have been an interesting movie.....
reviews.content: There are times where you come across a movie that has a lot of potential, but we end up witnessing its collapse under the weight of its own pomposity. Such is this one. There seems to be no sympathy between the acting or direction. A change in both would have helped. Instead it comes across as point scoring (bad old humanity has to be saved by human- robot hybrids) pretentious, and heavily sign posted. The story lends itself to many other movies, such that a re- write is not only possible but essential. A lost opportunity.

reviews.review_title: Singularity is a black hole; and you wish someone would have dropped this film down one.
reviews.content:
Numerous plotholes. Gigantic, Buick-sucking plotholes.
Scene: in the near future, artificial intelligence is invented. It quickly wipes out humanity.
Okay then we telescope time 97 years later. Humanity is down to a few scattered survivors... Roughing it in the wilderness with perfect hair, manscaped beards, clean and fashionable clothing in immaculate shape.
With supplies running out, oh wait, where did that 1980's Polaroid instamatic camera come from? Why does its batteries work? Or why does it have film in it?!?
Special effects I was okay with for a low budget flick. Acting was... passable for a low budget. 
The script however, oh God, the script. What a mess. 
They tried to have a twist ending, but it doesn't make sense with anything else.
It's a crying shame that other movies are not green lit that stand the chance of being decent stories. This one should have been flushed.

This film was among the worst I have watched in quite some time. The storyline was laughable with scant and poorly executed special effects. Cusack's entire appearance in the film was spent mugging and uttering nonsensical dialogue. The young leads cannot act whatsoever and their dialogue was juvenile and absolute trash. Honestly, the plot that the film tried to accomplish, and failed miserably, could be fascinating and I am hoping a movie can be made, in more skilled hands, although it wouldn't take much skill to make a film better than this. I do agree with reviewers who stated the positive ratings on this film were most certainly not genuine. No one with a modicum of intelligence and taste would find this film anything other than garbage.

So horrible graphic, please do not watch this movie or your eyes will burn. Watch any other movie you haven't seen yet but please, skip this one. Special effects are dire - in the opening scenes burning buildings look like someone went mad with the Photoshop clone tool. Explosions don't cast any light on objects that are close by and clouds of dense smoke don't cast any shadows and dissipate in moments leaving no trace. Enormous bots appear to defy the laws of physics and move through dense forestry without causing a single tree to move. Lighting.... I mean really.... what is happening with the lighting? In a dark and dingy forest, and it looks like two blazing follow spots behind the cameras.... just cheap and nasty.
The absolute worst movie I've ever seen. The other 1 Star reviews sum it up admirably so, enough already.

Terminator Salvation with Katniss Everdeen. It will pass 90 minutes on a rainy Sunday afternoon. Production quality is decent but the story is a complete rip off. What has happened to John Cusacks Career? Really liked him as an actor and seems to have dropped to the straight to DVD category.

Is this all John Cusack can get now? Don't recognize any of the other actors. That is not surprising really because such a cheap film. It is obvious they have taken bits from blockbuster sci-fi films and twisted them a bit to make this film. Female lead reminds me a bit of Gemma Arteton.

reviews.review_title: A sad waste of ok special effects
reviews.content: I like good science fiction. This was poorly acted and written. Fast forwarded to a leaden finish. Good effects crew let down by a confused weak script and lacklustre acting.

reviews.review_title: Epic bad acting over re-hashed scifi plot
reviews.content: Every actor in this was the worst at their craft, including John Cusack who texted-in, didn't even bother to phone-in, his wooden silly performance. The two younger actors can maybe plead inexperience and bad direction. The plot is just a mish-mash ripoff of bits of Terminator and Matrix and every other "computers rule the world" scifi - all done better than this. It had a few decent effects so I gave it a 2, but really NOT worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: I registered on IMDB just to leave an appropriate review for this garbage..
reviews.content: Disgusting. Horrid acting. Appalling script. Millions of holes and now coherence. Junior High drama school could do a better plot and film.
Don't waste 80+ minutes of your existence with this utterly awful piece of filmmaking The equivalent of lift music at a rave, this is the definition of straight to DVD movies

reviews.review_title: I understand that this movie is Low Budget, but hear me out...
reviews.content: I get what everyone is saying. "How can a movie like this exist?" "Why would they make it?" "Everyone looks too healthy..." Etc...Listen. If you like sci-fi movies that are very interesting and keep you around because you must see what happens next, then this movie is perfect for you.Yes it is low budget and the acting is not the absolute best, but look past all of that. This movie is so interesting and I loved the ending! It really makes you root for the main characters to do whatever it takes to reach Aurora.And did I mention that I loved the ending? I really felt like I was a part of the story. Movie snobs will never give this a chance. But if that is not you, then go for it! I'm very happy I did and I hope they make a sequel.

When making a direct-to-vdeo/streaming B movie with a tired premise, there are decisions a director can make to elevate a bad film.Here some suggestions :* MECHS! Mecha are instantly attractive to audiences. Play that up. Exploit the mechs. It's a great angle. Singularity doesn't have enough mechs.* GORE! Gore in a bad film automatically makes it more enjoyable. Heck, even memorable. Singularity doesn't have any gore : (* SCORE! The featured score is boring and serviceable. Why not make your low budget film stand out with a more avant-garde score? IE: Decoder (1984)With its lousy script that didn't give the actors much to do, this film was doomed, and nothing was done to 'punch it up'. I never thought I'd see John Cusack in a worse film after 2012. I was wrong. Singularity is that film. At least 2012 was unintentionally hilarious.Some of the locations and shots are genuinely beautiful. Some of the special effects shots even look great. This could have made a very good video game. A good film? Definitely not.
Was disappointed. The effects are so early 2000s but the movie was made in 2017

Thankfully, only invested 10 minutes into this turd. AI kills humanity. Film maker makes horrible film.  Why Netflix showed it to me as five stars, I'll never know.Thankfully, this hints that the singularity is still a ways off.

reviews.review_title: Hunger Games meets Terminator meets Divergent, not in a good way
reviews.content: Have some fun and watch this movie with some drinks. Everyone take a shot when they see a similarly to Hunger Games, Terminator or Divergent. Kronos, an artificial intelligence program has promised to save the world, but instead eliminated 99.9% of human kind. The female survivor, Catniss, err I mean, Calia, is a cross bow toting, leather jacket wearing 'badass' with a single side braid, who aside from her initial stern closed-off behavior, is actually very jumpy, not aware of her surroundings, and immediately clingy. The male character, Andrew, shows up with a fresh cut and some clean ones (ok maybe I'm embellishing on the ones part), rocking the mockingjay necklace, which happens to match Calia's pendant, signifying a believe in "Aurora" (an unharmed city). After immediately winning her trust, they play around in some abandoned houses, messing with radios and Polaroid cameras, all while dodging 50ft A.I.robots, and snuggling like a pack of puppies at night. They were attacked by a gang, where after being tied to a tree, busting out of his restraints and taking down 4 men to save Calia, Andrew learns he has super strength. After being struck by a sword and another night of playing puppies, Calia realizes that Andrew is leaking something other than blood. He isn't human, he's A.I as well. I must admit I lost interest at this point. Calia gets upset and leaves, Andrew learns he's A.I in a human body, and in the Kronos lab. Somehow Calia comes back to save him, lightly taps him to wake him up, where he returns the favor with an uppercut. Unable to give up on true love, Calia kisses Andrew while hes choking her (maybe she's kinky?). Andrew remembers and returns the kiss ( hello Divergent), then carries her into a corn field. I honestly didn't follow the rest. I watched this sans alchohol so it wasn't fun. But, all in all, it was unoriginal with terrible acting, but the plot had potential to be something good. They unfortunately missed the mark

Netflix suggested this movie based on my love for the Post-Apocalyptic setting.If you can go into this movie with the knowledge that you won't be getting the likes of Mad Max, Book Of Eli, Terminator, etc, then you might enjoy it for its (unintended) comedic value. If you want something serious, stop reading now.Initially, I had no idea what to expect with this movie. On one hand, the movie had pretty good production value, a seemingly serious tone, and John Cusack!However, the OTHER hand soon appears; It consists of wooden acting, glaring details totally incongruent with a supposed P-A world, and a nice spoon-fed plot narration by the bad guys... in case you're having trouble following along.I quickly realized that the intended demographic for this movie is the "Twilight" generation. The movie takes itself very seriously but is willing to sacrifice realistic aspects for the aesthetics of keeping the main characters attractive at all times... in a post-apocalyptic world. Example: the main male lead has frosted tips in his hair, which no one ever makes a joke or mention of. Basically, if you can laugh at things like that (unintentional humor), the movie is palatable. It never actually gets boring or painful to get through. As the director probably did, you too, will often forget that the movie even takes place in a war-torn world.Verdict: This movie would be great fodder for MST3K/Rifftrax
****4/10*** for making me laugh more than the recent Netflix comedies.

reviews.review_title: Really you called it a movie
reviews.content:
The movie is so bad don't even try to watch it,
The actors was awful especially "Andro" his eyes is always wide open seems like the king of stupid people .

reviews.review_title: A Poor Writers Battlestar Galactica Origin Story-sorta
reviews.content: There is so much bad here that I will start with the good. This is a film you watch in the off chance that you are stuck in an elevator and begin to play worst films ever. When someone brings up Singilarity, you will immediately become friends.This film is told in three parts. The opening with overcrowded Mega cities and robots seemed promising. However, there is no backstory on why wars are being waged or who is fighting whom.The middle part doesn't exactly make sense.The AI kills 8 Billion people over night. It then spends near 100 years and over an hour of story time searching for stragglers and El Dorado sorry Aurora. The AI spends considerable resources on this remnant of humanity. It's never really established why, or what all that other robo-tech used to kill the first 8 Billion is doing.The third phase is that it's revealed that Aurora is a different planet. The heroine has fallen for a Trojan Horse Adaptive Android who was created to infiltrate, find Aurora and destroy the last human city. Welp, the heroine ignores that existential conundrum and says she cannot go to Aurora without the Android. The space ship leaves. Armed with the coordinates to Aurora the John Cusick powered AI sends a fleet to purge humanity. Movie ends.That's the highlights. There is stiff acting, as well as a droning musical score that was likely created in Apple'e Garage Band software. The lighting is spotty. What suckers you into the film is the John Cusack and Carmen Argenziano billing until you realize that Cusack is just mailing it in. Cusack used to be a promising young actor. Now you pine for his sister's IS Cellular commericials. The other atttractive thing is the premise. However the execution is a complete fail.Lastly, I look forward to hearing about the amazing stories Julian Schanffner tells his Uber passengers about his brief fling in acting. He was simply the word that describes five notches below horrible.Watch the film and be inspired to write a review. It's the minimum recompense you are due for your time.

reviews.review_title: C rated version of Terminator Salvation
reviews.content:
Gets two stars only because it wasn't that long.
Stupid story line, bad acting and a waste of time. Stupidest thing of the movie? They come across other human survivors who actually look like dirty, unkempt and like they live in that one set of clothes 24/7, but the two main characters never get dirty even though they've been going through the woods, wading through nasty water and sleeping on the ground for days in the same clothes. The female lead even has rings on her fingers and never a hair out of place...lol. The male lead always has a stupid wide eyed look on his face. Netflix get your own stories and stop making horrible imitations of the real ones. Like I said, C rated...it's so bad it surpasses bad B rated movies...enough said.
Writing sucked because a silver spoon rich millenial thought it would be cool to make a movie.

I don't know why, but John Cusak annoys me in movies. So when I first saw his face in the movie I said out loud, "Ugh-I'm giving this movie 20 more minutes.".Sure enough I saw action in that time frame so I kept watching. It didn't take long for me to realize that it largely resembled "The Matrix". However, Cusak impressed me in his villain role. The young boy annoyed me with his constant freezing like an idiot when he should be running. Too much drama in unreal contexts. They also "bit" some things from "The Hunger Games". While there was definitely action and moments of intensity, it came off as a reductive version of "The Matrix" to me as so many other movies. If they make a sequel, I probably won't watch it.

It is difficult for me to decide which is worse, the writing, the acting, or the production. Whoever wrote this trash should not be allowed to write anything, ever again. Not even a postcard. There are SO many holes in this trash, its like a screen door. The actors seem to be parodying bad acting. Yes, it is THAT bad. The budget for this trash would have been better spent to send everyone involved in it to a career evaluation seminar. Cusack must have needed to make a car payment to take this role. Even he was trash. Any moron can just stare off into space and give a flat line or two at a time. New clothes, fresh crops, towns and items that certainly do not look 97 years old. No explanation of HOW THE HELL humans discovered hyperspace travel while getting systematically eradicated, ALL IN ONE DAY!!! The movie specifically says that 8,000,000,000 lost their lives almost overnight. Yet they had time to invent hyperspace travel to a planet they just discovered earlier that day? Terrible. Awful. Waste of time. Negative stars. This trash should be used as a form of torture.
