reviews.content: Worst of everything - bad acting, horrible script, worst directing ever ... there is nothing in this movie that is redeemable. Wow just wow ... pathetic.

So many negative exaggerations....I personally liked the movie and I think it leads perfectly into the option of a sequel. I don't know what more to say except watch for the movie it is, not the movies it isn't. In other words, don't compare it to another movie. The girls accent is very choppy but I think that's just the way she speaks and I actually came to enjoy listening to her. I enjoyed the movie.

reviews.review_title: Like a very fine Twilight Episode
reviews.content: This is a well paced, well directed, reasonably well acted and entertaining movie, who would've thought? From the story description one might think this is another cliché commercial movie and I must confess that I was not too interested to watch this movie because I expected just another special effects circus. However, as I am a big fan of Science Fiction movies, I thought I would give this film at least a chance. I must say that despite the trailer and some other comments here you will discover a very tender film about remaining good despite living on a destroyed world. The young actors Andrew and Calia might not be at A level yet but their performance is good enough to let you feel the basic story of friendship and trust. Cusack and Argenziano play their role well and are a good contrast to the young actors. Overall I would recommend this movie to everybody who is interested in watching a film that is more than just special effects. This is definitely not another Terminator movie but more of a very fine Twilight Episode. My final rating: A+

First review on this site ever, .... But in can not let this pass me by... this is one of the worst ever made/ so sad.Story, plot and timeline, this was just put together at random. Even the story is nonsense, not even an attempt to copy a major release movie... Come on! How can one rate this 10/10... putting all other AI movies to shame. For all I care the big robot in Robocop "running in stop motion", made a better acting performance then the whole crew of this movie!!!!! if you see the opportunities one get to release a movie, which are very limited.. this takes a huge amount of airtime to waste for better directors and upcoming talented people.

Not sure where this film was going. Made little sense. Too many gaps to accurately grasp what is happening.

reviews.review_title: bad movie that keeps you to the end
reviews.content: how is that possible,that such a bad movie will keep you watching it to the very end of it( well almost ,forced myself half way). first I thought J. C. was a producer , but no..., is it a low budget - yes it is . then I had to see other titles by R.K. Guy is clearly between Poltergeist -2001: A Space Odyssey and a Star wars. now the movie : 97 years old Polaroid battery works??97 years old wooden door work???and the worst - the WAtcher has a panoramic view all the time?? It seems like the movie was made between few beers ,some parts are good, and then there is a shocker,or maybe the bar got closed.
The acting and the movie was just terrible. It was like watching paint dry.

Singularity is a science fiction film with an eerily dystopian feel, directed by first time director Robert Kouba. It promises the world but does it actually deliver? I believe so. It could've been better if the concept was more unique, and the casting was better but doesn't that happen all the time? I was entertained and it left me wanting for more.The film moves at a good pace, and the performances given by the main actors are believable and engaging. If you want to enjoy a good indie sci-fi you will find this a perfectly pleasant way to spend a couple of hours.There was enough of action and intrigue to keep me focused for the duration of the film, and I was actually a little disappointed when the credits rolled. The actors, who to be fair are mostly a bunch of unknowns gave performances to be proud of, and you could feel the drama in the air, even when they would have undoubtedly been acting against the backdrop of the good old green screen.Would I recommend this film to a friend? Well provided they enjoy movies in the sci-fi arena I certainly would suggest it as a great way to spend an evening. While it is far from Oscar-winning, Singularity is an enjoyable fun romp into a broken world.

Lazy plot, lazy script, lazy sets, lazy lighting, lazy acting, lazy continuity, lazy movie. I don't mind a B movie but this is C or D. Really poor film-making and I'm surprised to see John Cussack involved.

The acting in this film is pretty bad. Even John Cusack's acting is stilted. The worst scene for me was when the escape from the lab as its self destructing and walk through a neatly tended field of wheat. I guess for some reason the machines need wheat?
If you were to take Terminator, Hunger Games, Darryl Dixon's crossbow, add a dash of Ear Games, and add some Sauron and his magic eye and put in a blender you would end up with this movie - CRAP!

It's like a knock off Hunger Games, Maze Runner, Eagle Eye, and Terminator, except 1000 times worse......what was John Cusack thinking?!?! He was acting more like Nicholas Cage, *shudders*. Not even laughably bad, just painfully bad. If you see an amazing trailer of some obscure movie you've never heard of, chances are the actual film is horrible....this movie proves that point.

reviews.review_title: You made me watch THAT with my own 2 eyes?
reviews.content: If this movie were graded like a college research paper the writer would be expelled for plagiarism. They are trying so hard to cash in in the popularity of the Hunger Games they forgot to have anything be original. I will be surprised if there are not lawsuits filed. Yes, it's that bad. I can forgive bad special effects if the plot and characters are good. Nope. Not in this movie. It's just dismal beginning to end. This is my first and probably only review of a movie. Save yourself and go take a nap instead.

I found this film by accident and wasn't very impressed at first. It looked like yet another cheap sci-fi straight to vod production but I didn't really have anything else to do so I rented it and boy was I wrong.This film is very well done. The execution is superb and the story is unique (even though the concept is familiar). I love the conflict between the boy and the girl and was hooked from the very beginning! (keep in mind I just wanted to watch and laugh for a few minutes at cheap cgi but ended up watching the whole thing because I was just so drawn into the story).The concept feels like something you might've seen before but the film offers so much more than just good looking visuals. It's a story about our own humanity and brings up a very poetic question Can an artificial intelligence feel love?".I don't know where this movie came from and I initially thought it would be complete rubbish but I ended up really enjoying it. I would definitely recommend it!

reviews.review_title: Not horrible but needs better explaining
reviews.content: Its a good movie for the idea value, but not much else.nothing is detailed or explained, and if aurora is on another planet then kronos shouldn't go after them, because its objective was to save earth, if the humans are gone from earth, then that should satisfy the directive. also, i didn't get the whole brother existing in two worlds thing without really going back to think about it. i don't thing too many people understand what is happening. i do however hope there is a sequel, then perhaps it will define as a planetary combat movie, and not a rouge AI movie. also maybe a sequel can explain things in a better light then the first one did. overall, not a "bad" movie, but definitely room for improvement.

Picture this: 
An eight foot tall Spanish speaking magician forced its way out of your belly button and, as you writhe in agony from the gaping hole in your gut, begins aggressively to persuade you to be the volunteer of the lamest and longest series of card tricks you'd ever muster patience for, but you stick around because John Cusack. 
This magician experience is more enjoyable and less confusing than the steaming pile of elephant snot Singularity turned out to be.
I created an IMDB account solely to find a way to voice my dislike for this movie.

reviews.content: This was terrible, and you are better off staring at a wall. What has happened to John Cusak????? Without him I never would have tried. The premise was like a cheap terminator and the acting was bad, with cheesy special effects. Please watch only as a movie to make fun of.

The story is slow, boring, immature that there's nothing to look forward while watching it. Poor number of cast.. movie runs over caila and andrew that needs more acting workshop. In short. It stole my almost 1 hr. time to watch it.wasted of my time.

This movie had a great premise. Robots taking over. But the writing is childlike and the 2 leads male and female are just terrible. Not one second were ther believable. 8 billion dead and these 2 idiots survived? A wimp and a princess right out of a make up trailer acting like survivalists?? Oh please! Terrible casting, directing and writing. Casting in any movie is essential. These low budget movies hire anyone who can breathe....this movie sucks.

This film is pretty bad. ... I watch movies of all sorts, all genres, including so-bad-they-are-good movies, doesn't matter the country. I am by no means an expert, but, I do have a little bit of an academic background, having taken some film studies courses in college (covering American film and European film). And I've been exposed to some highlight Bollywood movies, and highlight Asian films (mostly Korean and Japanese films, because I spent some time there.) So, I have a good, broad grasp or sense of knowledge of world cinema in general.For the best of the worst in horror / fantasy, there are the American treasures 'Plan 9 from Outer Space' and 'Troll 2', and the South Korean 'Dragon Wars: D-War'. For drama, there is Tommy Wiseau's 'The Room'...This movie is enjoyable in the same vein as these aforementioned gems. It is filled with confusing storytelling, inconsistencies, or at least not-so-believable situations or plot, pretty bad special effects, horrible dialogue, possibly intentionally bad acting, and just plain, blatantly ripped-off elements from other movies. And they pronounce 'Gliese' wrong; it is pronounced 'GLEE-zuh' or 'GLEE-suh'. ... I enjoyed writing my clever title for this review. I highly recommend taking an ambien tablet (or whatever your drug of choice may be) and watching this.

reviews.review_title: Pitiful effort to evoke the Hunger Games
reviews.content:
I usually really like movies with a dystopian future theme. but there are exceptions. Water World, any of them to do with climate change, The Matrix. The best of them are often adapted from novels, such as A Clockwork Orange, The Hunger Games, Blade Runner and so on.
This show is a mish mash pasting together of some other film with new scenery with John Cusack as a dreadfully dull bad guy.
Dull says it all about this thing. If it tried for humor there might have had some success. As it is, meh.

This is my first review ever. But the movie is soooo bad that i felt compelled to warn others about it. I've probably seen others that were as bad. But I honestly can't think of a single one. Poor actors and everyone else associated with this movie.

reviews.review_title: It was so bad it made me angry
reviews.content: I could not stop checking how far I was from the end... What a forgettable piece of trash! And the lead guy, please never ever cast him in anything EVER AGAIN! What a terrible actor he was! Wide eyed deer 80% of the time. "Oh I'm a robot boy but somehow my super cpu brain can't comprehend anything I see, beep boop beep." Terrible. I streamed this movie on Netflix but I'd put it in a shredder if I had it on disc. Nothing was accurate, what so ever. If Walking Dead can do the apocalyptic world guys, guess what, you could try a little harder. And the end! What in the world was that?! Let's have an emotional moment while we're desperately running out of seconds to leave the planet! And where were all these cameras that the big bad robot guys were using to view them like that?!! How did that even work? There's so many holes in this story, that I don't know how it held together at all. I only finished it because I believe in giving movies a fair chance, but this movie?! Don't. I'm actually mad about this movie. Waste. Of. Time. I need a cigarette.

I absolutely LOVE John Cusack, so I'm gonna do myself a favor, tell myself he lost a bet, do my damn best to save others from wasting precious time on this sadness. I don't know what I hated most about this... "movie"... but I'm going with a plea to the entire movie making industry.. PLEASE!! Please don't give either of those young will-never-be actors another shot at stealing time from other human beings EVER again. And whatever the bet John lost... I'm sure he's learned his lesson.

reviews.review_title: This movie, Singularity, has made me finally sign into IMDB!
reviews.content: I've finally figured out how Netflix works. Spend a big chunk of money on ONE well known actor to push to movie and then it don't matter if it's crap because of that one actor. This movie is horrible. The acting is way off. I'm not an actor and if I done worse I would be very disappointed in myself.

Premise sounds familiar. Man invents militarized machines, machines destroy all but one human. One human finds another human with a "come with me if you want to live" Vibe.
There is one exception. The visual effects in the original terminator where YEARS ahead of this production's.

reviews.review_title: Calm the hate, and see this for what it is, a first film by students, that lucked out getting a couple big name cameos
reviews.content: I'll say for starters, this is not a great film, not when compared to actual studio productions. What it feels like is a home project, for the two main leads or the director, as either university study, or just a hobby that grew into a full length film, so don't expect studio quality or the kind of continuity tracking or set design that would go along with this. There are other signs of unexpected growth with jerky plot motion, and filler dialogue by narration. All the scenes with Cusack appear to have been done over a single day shoot, in a darkened hotel room, and for the most part are repeated snap shots of him staring into space, later filled with graphics, done with a regrettable flatness; though it may be he's only done this as a favour.. Carmen feels more involved with the project. The plot and dialogue are a bit sketchy for them to work with though, think terminator universe, with hunger games mockingbird characters, and you won't be far off.However it's not all terrible, you can tell a lot of work has gone into it, and the graphic scenes could be very well done at times. The actors are young and inexperienced, but I thought the female lead at least kept it alive from an emotional stand point.If you're looking for a punt.. just keep expectation low. I don't mind that I've seen it, and it may be just a long way round to getting the attention of a studio to make the second part fully, and although I don't get why it was released as a film rather than handed in at end of term, you may find odd moments it doesn't suck, like I did.

I liked it. It's Science Fiction people ! There has to be a certain willing suspension of disbelief. The quest for artificial intelligence has bad results for humanity. Some people are saying this already. Oh and Jeanine M. Wacker has a nice face. That is all. You may return to your regularly scheduled transmission.

reviews.review_title: 2 Hours and 19 Minutes You Will Never Get Back
reviews.content: Please, if you have any self respect or respect towards your loved ones do not let your eyes see any frame of this god awful movie. If you would even call it a movie and not a just a video made by a child on a camera phone. The story follows the well dressed Katniss Everdeen along with a prepubescent grease ball who looks like he just got out of a dressing room. They are traveling to Aurora. A uncreativley named village where the humans who didn't watch the movie live. Meanwhile, the entire world is being destroyed by a Kronos a poorly named AI and some transformers. The scenes with Cusak are improvised from the filming of a totally different film. The film box officed 4000 dollars. That should be a warning. It is PG 13 because it was rated by 3 year olds. Don't be fooled. The original Imbd rating was 2.0 but it got bumped to 4.6. This is because they bought reviews. Please do not get this film it is a wast of 50 cents that could be spent on cancer research not making movies that are cancerous. So please have Congress ban this movie and to John Cusak. Why? How could you be so desperate. The movie budget 100,000 dollars. You were played almost nothing. Why would waste your talent on this. Don't even get me started on the non existence of continuity. Well, goodbye and let this be a warning that may save your life.

I can only Imagine that John Cusak lost a drunken bet so that he had to be in the worst film he could possibly find. Just don't watch this film.

reviews.review_title: This may be the worst movie I have ever seen
reviews.content: Story, acting, writing, direction...awful. This may be the worst movie I have ever seen. Plan 9 was better. I kid you not. I fell asleep after 5 minutes, woke up...fast forwarded through it, I simply could not take it. Cusak must have needed a mortgage payment.

reviews.review_title: Not, perhaps, as bad as the 11+ pages state?
reviews.content: Aw, Gods! Am I gonna love this! ;) OK! Here goes! There's about 11+ pages of people pouring fire and brimstone over this movie. So... Let's do the easy stuff first.Yes, CGI is often horrible. There's no matching the background lighting and colors. Sometimes I've seen a lot worse and from, for instance, SYFY.Acting could have been better. Eileen Grubba isn't too bad as Andrew's mother. And, all likenesses to a certain Katniss Everdeen aside, Jeannine Wacker has potential. Julian Schaffner should, however, attend acting classes more often, though. Being kewt just isn't enough these days. Sorry, kiddo!Some (most) people complain about John Cusak's and Carmen Argenziano's acting (from bad to worse and WTF) and the fact that there's a city with bright lights on in skyscrapers. Some 97 years after Armageddon.How 'bout this! Go back to about 4:40 into the movie and hear Kronos say "I will feel you. Do not be afraid" and ponder what that implies. If you still don't get it, fast forward to about 9:20 and watch Elias moving about. Still no response? Well, fast forward again to 36:13 and listen to what Calia says.Cusak's and Argenziano's acting isn't half bad considering the above. It's like they have no real choice. Still don't get it? Repeat ad nauseum! But, hey, this isn't a movie with outstanding character portraits. It's Sci-Fi!Yes, there are similarities to Terminator. Of course there are. And I'm not talking about possible dupes of robots. I mean, if an AI reaches singularity and takes over, what would you expect? Humans are, after all, something to be... dealt with. Perhaps Kronos did the right thing after all?About a year ago, on SciFi-movies.com, the movie "Aurora" popped up. A full length feature by Robert Kouba, a young Swiss short film maker. A bit of investigation gave that crowd funded "Aurora" had been canceled and, thusly, I wrote to Scifi-movies and had it removed. I thought Kouba would be out of the picture. Check out the trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XcohH3YG4tMAs you can see from this trailer, it's "Singularity"! So, "Aurora" lived on and became "Singularity". Finally.Have I seen better movies? Of course I have! Have I seen worse? No doubt about that! So, I actually do rate this a 5 despite all the deficiencies.Clear your mind and watch it!

reviews.review_title: I personally find it very good
reviews.content: The movie is something you do not see often in the cinemas, it's something mind-blowing and located in a futuristic scenario. I see a lot of people saying that it is not worth to see it... They're absolutely wrong. If the film was written by Cristopher Nolan, everybody would say that it is incredible, but everybody is expecting something amazing, not considering that the 90% of the movies made in Hollywood are worse, and rate Singularity very low. That people deserve films like "Baywatch" for the rest of their life. Before seeing it, you should consider that it is not a high budget film and the director is young; and I find the idea so good, so I can say the director is very talented; the actors have not a lot of experience (except of John Cusack), but they managed to act very well (ofc they're not Johnny Depp or Emma Stone, but still.). Anyway, The graphics are as good as a Transformers movie, maybe the lights are a little bit strange sometimes, but the work with the green screen is undoubtedly very very well made. I didn't expect something amazing, but the film left me stunned, I believe in the director and in the actors, they have a bright future. I want to give a 10/10 to support, the film himself, considering the whole world of cinema, could be easily a 7.5/10.

Not sure why there are so many negative comments. Not the best film ever by far. But reasonable plot, effective acting, special effects where needed. Overall ok to watch. If you are only interested in mega budget films then you are missing the point. Entertainment is looking for new ideas, seeing new plots, different viewpoints, new actors. Not the same story written over and over again, with the same so called big star actors

reviews.review_title: Terminator Salvation meets Katniss, Cinderella and Pinocchio
reviews.content:
The story was derivative of Terminator Salvation and they told you that right at the start. Much of the dialogue between the young actor and actress was corny and felt forced. The story would go along smoothly and then sort of jump to conclusions that didn't add up. For example, the 'magic kiss' that woke up the robot somehow also caused the entire facility to crumble. It didn't just fry the computers, the concrete was literally crumbling within seconds of the 'magic kiss'. If the writers had a reason for it, it was edited out.
Jeanine Wacker was ok in her performance as the protagonist but her Swiss accent comes through loud and clear in her first few scenes which really threw me off. This was a dystopian future, 97 years in the future in the US. Why would our protagonist have a Swiss accent?
Julian Schaffner did a good job, even with some bad lines. He was probably the most consistent performer.
Cusack did a decent job with some bad dialogue. He had a couple of really good scenes that gave me hope for the rest of the film but ultimately the derivative nature made it a bit too predictable and there were too many scenes spent discussing the 'heart of being human' and what it meant to be good. Can the robot become a 'real boy'? Those scenes were the ones with the cheesiest dialogue.
I have seen worse movies but this was painful at times to continue to watch. I commend the young director on the cinematography, lighting and set selection.

reviews.review_title: Wow this is such a bad movie.
reviews.content: I wanted to give this movie 1/10. But I have to admit that it's not as bad as Plan 9 From Outer Space, or Manos The Hands of Fate. The special effects look better than paper mache and string. The background music is passable. The acting is slightly better than your average high school drama club. But all of this is overshadowed by the sheer stupidity of the plot and the dialog. I've seen some awful post-apocalyptic movies, from Logan's Run to Wall-E. Singularity blows them all away. It's terrible.It seems that whoever wrote this screenplay lacks the ability to predict what real people would do or say in a given situation. Scene after scene, the characters act in ways that make no sense and say things that no sane person would ever say. But at least they speak in sentences rather than gibberish. And I can understand the actors' accents. So kudos for that.

reviews.review_title: highlight beauty of simple things, and the beginning & end of artificial intelligence dilemma
reviews.content: It is set at the point in time of the rise of artificial being, and then it is set 5-generation into the future as Earth is devoid of humanity.Although people might be excited & desired to see the first part of the movie for its forward prediction on life & society of the future (which is brief), the second part is secretly & slowly highlight of the beauty of simple things with highly detailed & colourful shot of natures & characters as the character move forward the storyline to end the artificial intelligence dilemma as its closing story arc (and open a new one).This is a fresh story as the beginning & end of artificial intelligence rise is referred to by many times in various sci-fi future mythology but never played out, especially in video games.

reviews.review_title: Neither awful nor good... had promise but borrowed ideas, missed a script writer

The script is muddled, babble and nonsense, especially from the two young actors. I actually wanted John Cusack in the film more. The lines were a little cringeworthy in places e.g. "worst" was spoken. Overall, a case of glitz over substance, neither awful nor good. Shame as it reminded me of 80's films where bad was actually good though.

Worse yet is the arrogance of the production team making this film entirely based on the assumption that there would be a sequel so it had no proper or intelligent ending. DO NOT waste a minute of your life watching this garbage.

The kind of movie you half watch while playing games on your phone or cleaning up around your apt/house or....while writing a review, like this one. It's odd seeing Cusack in this kind of role, not a believable or convincing bad guy. File this movie under been there/done that.

...my wife won't let me have the remote and she has changed all the passwords on our streaming accounts. Now, that may sound harsh...but honestly I deserve worse for making her watch this movie. I spent 25+ years grooming my wife into a groovy SciFi, video game loving hottie. This one film has set us back at least 19 years. At least she is still hot and enjoys gaming. The special effects were surly done by a four year old running around with a parents cell phone. How in the world this movie is rated higher than one star is proof of alien life and the Illuminati running a shadow movie industry bent on melting our minds. Usually during a terrible movie I am constantly waiting for something to happen that at least makes my wife and I discuss what we have spent two hours watching. Not this tome. She immediately walked out of the room and didn't talk to me for 36 hours. Which is probably a good thing considering all the name calling and swearing she unleashed on me AFTER she cooled off. Please. Don't waste time watching this mess. It's not worth the time and will surely cause erectile disfunction and a drop of 30-40 IQ points. Chances are high we could end crime and war with the simple threat of forced viewing of this film. It is a weapon of mass destruction and should be illegal to view.

reviews.review_title: Wish I would have read others reviews...
reviews.content:
The one star reviews here are not wrong. This is a terrible movie with poor casting, stilted dialogue, and tons of plot holes. The background narration is awful AND it spoils scenes that are about to happen. The AI doesn't actually have a singularity moment (the freaking title of the movie!), and it's unclear how Cusack is watching him on camera at all times.
Did I mention the acting is bad. Worth mentioning again. With a cast of about five people, you'd think they'd do better.
There are so many things that bothered me about this movie (the perfectly trimmed and dyed hair during an apocalypse, the constant sad piano music in the background, absolutely no tense moments where you believed for a second that the heroes might fail), but I could have forgiven most of it if the movie didn't take itself so seriously. But it did. Lots of frowning and tears, and precisely one light moment where the main characters take pictures of each other with a conveniently intact poleroid camera in a conveniently intact house.
Don't waste your time with this trainwreck. There are plenty of great apocalypse movies out there.

I barely know where to start with this mess. Here's my issues, to add to all the others (obviously there's duplicates, but I'm not reading all the other reviews).
"Physical" inconsistencies:
So let me get this straight... There's an AI that controls the entire planet, but it can't track down an interstellar spaceship sitting on the surface of the planet?
Somehow humans were able to construct interstellar ships without the AI knowing?
Somehow they launched off the planet in the past, but the AI couldn't track them, or know where they left from?
100 years after the destruction after the vast majority of humans:
The ones that still exist somehow still have power to light flashlights? 
Batteries in a Polaroid camera still hold a charge?
Electronic devices that still function?
Someone has brand new looking Ø1" rope?
The AI can't track the remaining humans by their campfires?
The AI doesn't have thermal imaging?
Clothes are still "normal" looking?
The bow and arrows, which serve no purpose in the plot line other than to insert a character that looks like Katniss Everdeen into the story, look like they were just purchased from Cabelas?
Some unused buildings haven't been totally overgrown by nature and still look pristine on the inside even though windows are open for the past 100 years.
People and their clothes are still "clean" with pearly white teeth?This list is endless....I won't bother talking about the acting. Others have pretty much covered that. It suffices to say that it's terrible.Story sucks and just looks like it's trying to set up round 2.I blame Netflix for this recommendation.

reviews.review_title: As bad as Snowpiercer or The Room!
reviews.content: Idea is good, delivery is horrible!How after almost 100 years they got clean, fashionable, perfect fit cloths? Who made it? China is gone, who made it? Her GPS was working all this time, where did she dot power in destroyed world? Where those people got their electricity from? Who groomed those wild people, because they looked better groomed than me in the destroyed world, which was destroyed for 100 years...how is that possible? Why was the main actors hoodie was sparkling clean all the time? Even when he got slashed by a sword, hoodie was uncut! It is not possible! Where did she get new technology bomb? Why mashin would make something that litteraly kill them, if it wasn't them, then who? The girl has a crosbow...what is that about? She would shoot metal with crosbow? So the smartest AI in the world couldn't hack her GPS? And couldn't search for the castle with drones? They used amulate to start the ship, not human print but metal amulate, really? Why AI coun't do it?Another thing, guy punched the girl and she was like, no.. it's okay. Really, really.... . It wasn't him, it was a program...okay, but use other wordS, not "it's okay, it wan't you" more like "! Now, John Cusak. I hope they paid you a lot...like A LOT to be in that movie.So disappointed. You are an amazing actor with great skills...and that? really?I understand, everybody is the critic and have the right on their opinion, but please, next time hire a professional screenwriter, who has proper mind set on possible and impossible.Please, next time make a movie that make sense!

A B-movie rehash of Terminator Salvation (with a dash of The Matrix), except the android falls in love, and Helena Bonham Carter's SkyNet is replaced with a deranged Elon Musk played by John Cusack.The production values aren't bad for a B-movie, but the very, very shallow story offers nothing new. I think some of the problem is that the movie is barely an hour an a half long, so it ends up feeling rushed; with all the wasted scenes of Cusack watching from afar, it ends up feeling like an over-long short film instead of a feature-length story.I guess there's a bit of a surprise/twist ending, but when you see it you'll just think "Uh, OK."There were also oddities in the writing that broke immersion. For example:
Why would so many things still be functional almost a century later (manufactured clothes, oil in lamps, batteries in cameras)?Why did Elon Musk's brother become deformed?If the AI destroyed humanity without warning in 2020, how did humans have advanced technology hidden around for survivors to find? (avoiding spoilers a bit here)We're supposed to just take it on faith that an android on the humans' side will somehow turn the tide of a coming war with the AI.
